## Tables

The first 10 rows and first 5 columns of `ggplot2::mpg` are displayed in this fancy table: 

```{r, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(kableExtra)
tbl <- tbl <- mpg[1:10, 1:5]
tbl %>%
  kbl(color = "black") %>%
  kable_classic("striped", full_width = F) %>%
  column_spec(3, color = "black",
                bold = T,
              background = spec_color(tbl$displ, option = "D", alpha = 0.4)) %>%
  row_spec(5, color = "white", background = "black") %>%
  row_spec(0, color = "black", background = "cornflowerblue")
```

## Plots

Finally, I created this helpful plot. 

```{r, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
nycflights13::flights %>% 
  na.omit() %>% 
  filter(dep_delay > 0) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = dep_delay)) +
  geom_histogram() + 
  scale_x_log10()
```

Also, I did this using the following code:

```{r, eval = FALSE}
nycflights13::flights %>% 
  na.omit() %>% 
  filter(dep_delay > 0) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = dep_delay)) +
  geom_histogram() + 
  scale_x_log10()
```
